body.p: “I remark the different pale colors to which the grasses have faded and bleached. Those coarse sedges amid the button-bushes are bleached particularly light. Some “,” more slender “,” in the Pleasant Meadow “,” is quite light with singular reddish or pinkish radical blades making a mat at the base. Some dense sedge or rushes in tufts in the Andromeda Ponds have a decided greenish tinge “,” somewhat like well-cured hay.”
PE 10, pg. 55 / 13 May 1855-3 January 1856 / NNPM MA 1302:25 / T vol. # XIX / PDF # XIV / JVII & JVIII
